metadata.title: CVE-2022-45063 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
xterm before 375 allows code execution via font ops, e.g., because an OSC50 response may have Ctrl-g and therefore lead to command execution withinthe vi line-editing mode of Zsh. NOTE: font ops are not allowed in thexterm default configurations of some Linux distributions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45063` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xterm - 379-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xterm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '379-1ubuntu1').
